intro: Phaca bayeri, commonly known as the Bayery's phaca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
